# legal-research-organizer · Supabase-backed app (generated by Endstorm)

Idea:
> Legal Research Organizer SaaS. Next.js 14 + Supabase. Auth, workspace dashboard, case search, case detail view, side-by-side comparison, issue tagging, doctrine timeline, citation-locked answers (no citation=no output), CourtListener + GovInfo ingestion jobs, Postgres schema for cases/citations/issues/edges/audit_logs, compliance layer (research-only, no legal advice), and full install/run instructions.

This is a working Next.js 14 app scaffold with:
- Supabase Auth (signup/login/logout)
- Protected routes via middleware
- Supabase migrations (tables + RLS owner scoping)
- CRUD API routes + CRUD UI pages for your entities
- Integration plug surfaces so you can connect your own APIs

## 1) Prerequisites
- Node.js 18+
- A Supabase project (free tier is fine)

## 2) Configure Supabase keys
Copy `.env.example` to `.env.local` and set:
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL`
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY`
- `SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY`

## 3) Apply database migrations
Migrations live in:
- C:\Users\Larry Rogers\Endstorm\Endstorm1\Apps\legal-research-organizer\frontend\supabase\migrations\20260103171901_init.sql

Recommended workflow:
- Paste SQL into Supabase SQL editor, or use Supabase CLI.

## 4) Run the app
From this folder:

    npm install
    npm run dev

Open http://localhost:3000

## Entities
- **Cases** (cases) → /app/cases
- **Issues** (issues) → /app/issues
- **Citations** (citations) → /app/citations

## API surfaces
- Health: `GET /api/health`
- CRUD (bearer token required):
  - `GET /api/<table>`
  - `POST /api/<table>`
  - `GET /api/<table>/<id>`
  - `PATCH /api/<table>/<id>`
  - `DELETE /api/<table>/<id>`

## Integration plug surfaces
- Proxy:
  - `POST /api/integrations/proxy`
  - Set `INTEGRATION_PROXY_ALLOWLIST=api.example.com,another.com`
- Webhooks:
  - `POST /api/integrations/webhooks/<name>`
- Code modules:
  - `/lib/integrations/*`

## Notes
- The UI automatically sends bearer tokens when calling the API routes.
- Extend tables, fields, pages, and integrations to match your customer's requirements.
